[Petersburg, Va.]
div3.p: Large Sale of Manufactured Tobacco, Sugars, Soda Coffee, &C at Auction — On Wednesday morning, 11th March, commencing at 11 o'clock, at our store in iron building, Sycamore street--

list.item: 2,500 boxes Manf'd Tobacco, from medium to very fine brights;
25 begs Bi Carb Soda, recent arrival;

div3.p: Other articles may be added before the day of sale.
Sale without regard to weather.
div3.closer: Davis, Roper & Co. Aucts mh 9

div3.head:
By Redwood & Phillips, Auctioneers,
[54 Main street.]
div3.p: We will sell at our store, on Tuesday morning, 10th inst, a general assortment of Furniture, Miscellaneous Goods, etc.

Soda,
Concentrated Lye,
Ladies' Morocco Boots and Shoes,
Gents' heavy Boots.

Breguse,
10 yards Oil-Cloth.

div3.head: No reward.
div3.p: --I advertised a few days ago for a deserted Substitute from the 7th Confederate Regiment, Co F, and offered a reward for him; but I have since declined that idea of offering any reward.
div3.closer:
Spencer C. Lewis,
Enfield, N C. mh 9--1t*

div3.head: Information wanted
div3.p: --of R P Byrns, who left Baltimore for the South in May, 1862 Information of his whereabouts will be thankfully received by addressing

div3.head: Fine
div3.p: Just receive from and Frantick's fire Revolving Pistols; $8 and 20 Price each address
div3.closer:
H. E Nichols,
Columbia B. C. mh 9--3t*

div3.head: To Assistant Quartermasters and Commissaries.
div3.p:
--Gentleman in the above departments requiring information in regard to making out their papers properly, can obtain it by addressing "business," at this office.
All business confidential,

div3.head: By Goddin & Apperson, Auctioneers.
div3.p:
Four Lots at Rocketts, on Bloody Run street, nearly opposite the Gas Works, and three Lots on Church Hill, at the corner of 29th and Broad streets, for Sale at Auction — Will be sold at auction, on the premises, in the order advertised, on Monday, the 16th of March, 1863, commencing at 4 o'clock P M, four valuable Lots, located as above, fronting 178 feet on the East line of Bloody Run street, being the same on which formerly stood the old Seamen's Bethel.
After which will be sold 93 feet of land at the corner of 29th and Broad streets, to be divided into three lots of 31 feet by 132 feet. These lots are beautifully located.

Terms--All cash, or one-third cash; balance at 6 and 12 months, for negotiable notes, interest added, and secured by a trust deed.
The taxes for this year to be paid by the purchasers.

Five small Brick Tenements in Manchester, on the West side of Wadsworth, between Hall and Decatur streets, for Sale at Auction.--Will be sold at auction, on the premises, on Thursday, the 12th March, 1863, at 4½ o'clock P M, five small brick Tenements located as above, each fronting about 18 feet on the West side of Wadsworth street, running back 125 feet to an alley.

Terms.--One-third cash, the balance at 6 and 12 months, for negotiable notes, with interest added, and secured by a trust deed.
The taxes for 1863 to be paid by the purchaser.

div3.head: Lock out for the deserter--$30 reward.
div3.p:
--The above reward will be paid for the arrest of private Alexander Marx, who deserted his company and regiment near Fredericksburg, on the 11th January, 1863.
Said Marx is six feet two inches high, complexion light, blue eyes, light hair, and face pock-marked.
He is supposed to be making his way to Charleston, S C, to enlist in the Naval service.
Commanders of the Naval service are forbidden to enlist him, as he is a deserter from my company.
div3.closer:
J S Weitworth,
Lt Comm'g Co I, 6th Va Infantry.
Fredericksburg, Va., March 1st, 1863. mh 9--3t*

div3.p:
Valuable Farm for Rent at Auction on the Brook Turnpike, one mile from Richmond.--Will be rented out for the balance of the year, at auction, on Friday, the 13th March, 1863, at 4 ½ o'clock P M, on the premises, the valuable Farm of the late Mr John Darracott.
It contains 70 acres of valuable farming land.
The buildings on the estate are ample, and embrace every building usual for the genteel accommodation of a large family.
Terms--Bond with good security, conditioned to pay the rent half yearly, on the first days of July and January.

Two Framed Tenements, on Leigh and Smith streets, for Sale at Auction.
Will be sold at auction, on the premises, on Wednesday, the 11th March, 1863, at 4 o'clock P M, two Framed Tenements, located as above, near to Brook Avenue, one of which is suited to a Store or Dwelling.

Terms--Cash.
The taxes for this year to be paid by the purchaser.

div4.p:
House and Lot in Duval's Addition, near to Brook Avenue, together with House-hold Furniture, Horse, Wagon, Cows, Hogs, Saddles, &C, for Sale at Auction.--At the request of Mr John Schmidt, we shall sell at auction, on the premises, on Tuesday, the 10th of March, 1863, commencing at 12 o'clock M, the House and Lot located as above, adjoining the residence of Mr Jacob Keck, and near the residence of Mr Theodore Frick.
Also, all the Furniture belonging to Mr Schmidt, consisting of nine Feather Beds and many other articles.
Also, one fine Horse, one Wagon and Harness, two good Milch Cows, several Hogs, several good Saddles and Bridles, and a great variety of Tools, &c., appertaining to the butcher's business.
Terms.--Cash; the taxes for this year to be paid by the purchaser

P. S.--After the foregoing sale, will be sold those two ½-scre Lots, in Duval's Addition, Men 142 and 143, with a framed Tenement thereon, occupied by Fred Granger, and adjoining the property of Mr Andrew Muller.
Terms--As above.

div3.p:
Valuable James River Estate, of 542½ acres, in the county of Fluvanna, 65 miles above Richmond, for sale at Auction, together with the Crops, Stock, &c., thereon.--At the request of Mr Charles R Woodson, we shall sell at auction, on the premises, without limit or reserve, on Thursday, the 19th of March, 1863, at 11 o'clock A M, his valuable James river Estate, located as above, bounded on one side by the lands of Mr Charles Boswell, on the other by those of Mr John Toney.
The James River and Kanawha Canal passes through it. The tract contains, by recent survey, 542½ acres, of which 114 acres are low grounds, equal to any on the river; about 230 acres cleaned, high land, in fine heart, and the balance heavily set in fine oak and pine timber.--The buildings consist of a small Dwelling and the usual out buildings, such as barn, stable, quarters, etc. About 120 bushels of wheat have been seeded on the land, with a fine prospect of a good yield.
This estate, for its size is justly regarded as one amongst the most printable on the river.
It commands a fine view of the surrounding country.
The neighborhood is equal to any on the river.
After the sale of the land will be sold all the personal effects on it, consisting of the crops of Corn Oats, Hay, etc, together with 6 or 8 young large, and remarkably fine Mules.
Also, Cattle, Farming Implements, new Bacon, etc. Possession given at once, so that the purchaser may have the opportunity of cultivating the estate.

Terms.--For the land, all cash; or one-third cash; balance at 1 and 2 years, for bonds bearing interest, secured by a trust deed.
For the personal effects, cash.
The taxes for this year to be paid by the purchaser.
div3.closer:
Goddin & Apperson,
Auctioneers. mh 4

div3.p: The New and Valuable Distillery at Rocketts, near Gillie's Creek, for Sale at Auction. --We shall sell at auction, on the premises, on Tuesday, the 10th March, 1863, at 4 ½ o'clock P M, three fourths of the Lot located as above, fronting on the county road containing 4,78-1000 acres, having thereon a large brick building, used and built for a distillery, together with the Machinery therein, said to be in good order.
Also, two other Framed Tenements, adapted to Stores and Dwellings.
The foregoing property is regarded very valuable, and the location admirably adapted to the business of a distiller.

Terms--Cash, or one-third cash; balance at 6 and 10 months, for negotiable notes, interest added, secured by a trust deed.
The taxes for 1863 to be paid by the purchaser.

div4.p:
The Large, Elegant and Handsome Estate, called "Rocky Mills," on the South Anna river, in Hanover county, 20 miles Northwest of Richmond, for Sale at Auction, in Richmond. --Will be sold at our auction rooms, on Tuesday, the 3d March, 1863, at 12 o'clock M, that valuable farm called Rocky Mills, in Hanover county, on the South side of the South Anna river, 10 miles from Ashland and 12 miles from James river, and within 20 miles of Richmond, containing 1,041 acres of land, with buildings of the best kind, which have cost over $25,000. About 300 acres are in timber and pines, and the balance is cleared.
Lands rolling and well adapted to the usual crops.
Also, Dr Swan's old Mills, with — acres of land along Gold Mine creek, and likewise a timber tract of 302 acres in front, running down to near Beren Meeting-House.

Gentlemen are invited to ride up and examine this desirable estate; for, as a summer residence or permanent location, seldom such a chance presents itself.
The grounds about the mansion-house and the garden are among the best in the State.
The owner (A W Nolting, Esq) will be pleased to accommodate and lodge gentlemen going up to examine the property.
Terms.--One-third cash; balance at 1 and 2 years, with interest, and well secured.

Plats will be exhibited at our office as soon as received, and any further information given.
In the meantime, we earnestly invite those who may wish to purchase such an estate, to examine the premises, which will be shown by Mr Nolting.
Postponement.--In consequence of the inclemency of the weather, the above sale is postponed till Tuesday, the 17th March, 1863.

div3.head:
By Williamsen & Co, Aucts.,
[no. 192 Main st.]
div3.p: We will sell at our salesroom No. 192 Main street, between 9th and 10th, on Tuesday, the 10th inst, commencing at 10 o'clock A M, an extensive and varied assortment of fine Furniture, consisting in part of--

div3.head: By Hill, Dickinson & Co., Auct's.
div3.p: Commissioners' Sale of A Slave.--By virtue of a decree of the County Court of Henrico, of the 2d of December, 1862, in the suit of Martin's Admr., vs Kuhn et als, we shall sell for cash, at public auction on Wednesday, the 11th of March, 1863, at 11 o'clock A M, at the auction store of Hill, Dickinson & Co one slave named Robert.
div3.closer:
H A Claircryn, Com'ts
Thos Joyass, Com'ts
Hill Dickinson & Co Auct'rs mh 5--tds

div3.p: I will sen, on Wednesday, the 11th inst, at 10 o'clock at the office of Hill, Dickinson & Co, one Woman and her four children; also, one man. The woman is 24 years old. The Man is about 50 years old, and is a good Cook.
div3.closer:
Benjamin Temple,
Adm'r of L M Temple, dec'd. mh 7--cod3t

div3.head: By E. B. Cook, Auct'r.
div3.p: Sale of personal property at Schad's Garden, at Auction.--On Wednesday, 11th inst., at 10 o'clock, I will tell at Schad's Garden, on Franklin st, near the Baptist College, all the personal property belonging to Mr H Vendel, and the estate of Auguste Schad, dec'd, consisting of--

list.item: a general assortment of Parlor, Chamber, and Kitchen Furniture.
an assortment of 33 boxes superior Chewing Tobacco
a lot of Florida and Va Tobacco
a small lot of superior Cigars
Bar Room Furniture — the usual variety of Tumblers, Decanters, Pitchers,
looking Glasses, Tables, Chairs, etc, etc.

div3.p:
At the same time, I will sell the unexpired Leash of the premises.
The lease expires in May, 1864, and the garden offers inducements to any one wishing to engage in the same line of business.

div3.head: Blockade Goods at Auction.
div3.p: --On Tuesday, the 10th inst., at 10 o'clock I will sell at my store a desirable lot of Goods, embracing Boots Shoes, Gloves, Tooth Brushes, Braids Port Monnales, Combs, Pins, Linen Thread, Shoe Thread, Buttons Hooks and Eyes Blacking, Gun Caps, Cassimeres, Satinets, Sewing Silk, Wool and Felt Hats, Calf Skins Needles Extract of Coffee, Concentrated Lye, and many other goods much in demand.
will be sold at the C S Lot, Bacon's Quarter Branch, on Monday, the 16th day of March, commencing at 10 o'clock--
div3.closer:
W S Wood, Maj and Q M.
E B Cook, Auct. mh 7

div4.p: Large Sale of Groceries and Drugs at Auction.--on Tuesday, the 10th inst., commencing at 10 o'clock, we will sell, without reserve a Large and choice assortment of Groceries, Drugs, and Medicines, just to hand, including the following, viz:

list.head: --Also,--
list.item: A large invoice of Drugs and Medicines, consisting of--

div3.head: By Jas. M. Taylor & Son, Auct's
div3.p:
Valuable small Farm in Henrico county, containing 93 acres, within seven miles of Richmond and one mile of James River, for Sale at Auction.--At the request of Mr Joseph Vaughan, we will sell, upon the premises, on Wednesday, the 11th day of March, at 12 M, a small Farm located as above, now in the occupancy of Mr Vaughan.
It contains ninety-three acres, of which fifty acres are cleared and very highly improved; the remainder is heavily wooded with pine and oak, of virgin growth.--There is attached to the house an excellent orchard of choice fruit trees, a supply of good water, &c.
The improvements consist of a comfortable frame dwelling, with four rooms and two passages, kitchen, stable, barn, corn house, and all the usual out-buildings, all of which are in good repair.
This property adjoins the Westham estate, the lands of Mrs Patterson, Mr Crafton, and others.

Terms.--One-third cash; or the whole, if preferred; the balance at 4 and 8 months, for negotiable notes, interest added, and secured by a trust deed.
The purchaser to pay the taxes for 1863.
After the sale of the above will be sold the Stock, Crops, and Farming Implements--for which cash will be required.

A Desirable Brick residence on the North side of Marshall, near 24th streets, at Auction. --We will sell upon the premises, on Friday, the 13th day of March, commencing at 4 o'clock P M, a very desirable brick residence, at the corner or Marshall and 14th streets, now occupied by Mrs Kidd.
It contains six good rooms, together with a Kitchen and Stable.
The lot fronts 24 feet and runs back 150.

Terms.--One-third cash; the balance at 4 and 8 months, for negotiable notes, with interest added, and secured by a trust deed.
The purchaser to pay the taxes for 1863.

div3.head: By Sorey & Boissean, Auctioneers.
div3.p: On Thursday morning, the 19th day of March, 1863, we will sell at our storehouse, on Main street, Danville, Va., commencing at 10 o'clock--

list.item: 3,650 boxes Manufactured Tobacco, including different brands, from medium to very fine;
2,000 gallons choice Brandy and Rye Whiskey.

div3.head: Steam Saw and Grist Mill for Sale.
div3.p: --By virtue of a deed of trust from A J Cardoza to me, bearing date the 3d day of January, 1859, and duly recorded in the Clerk's Office of Powhatan County Court, I will, on Thursday, the 12th day of this month offer for sale at public auction, for cash, a steam Saw and Grist Mill, in good order, situated on the land of Mr Bolling Cosby, on the River Road, and near the place called "Sixer Town, in Powhatan county.
div3.closer: W J Dance, Trustee. mh 7--2t*

div3.head: Deserter.--$50 reward.
div3.p:
--I will pay the above reward for the apprehension and delivery of John Kelly to me, at Howard's Grove Hospital near Richmond.
The said Kelly is an Irishman, and substituted in my company on the 1st of January, 1863.
He deserted on the evening of the 4th of March, 1863.
He is about 5 feet 8 inches high, light hair, blue eyes, and a broad full face, a little inclined to be red. He had on when he left a gray jacket and pants, and a common wool hat. He said his family lived near Rocketts.
div3.closer:
Geo W Minor, Capt com'g
Co R 40 regt Va Vols. mh 9--3t*

div3.head:
Camp near Petersburg
March 4th, 1863.
div3.p:
One hundred dollars reward.--The above reward will be paid for the apprehension and delivery of Patrick Murphy, who was put in my company as a substitute, on the 9th of February, and deserted on the 18th of February, 1863.
Said Murphy is of Irish descent, 5 feet 7 inches high, dark complexion, dark hair and dark eyes; has rather an awkward carriage, a down cast look, and when he deserted he had a full pair of whiskers, slightly gray.
He is probably in Richmond or its vicinity.
div3.closer:
G Allensworth, Capt Co C,
30 h Reg't Va Int'ry. mh 7--3t*

div3.head: Thirty dollars reward
div3.p:
--Will be paid for the apprehension and delivery at Castle Thunder, Richmond, of private Wm Suddenston, a deserter from the U. S. Marine Corps.--Aged 20 years, height 5 feet 3 ½ inches, eyes hazel, hair auburn, complexion dark.
Supposed to have enlisted in a volunteer company and gone to Fredericksburg.
div3.closer:
A Taylor,
Major and Q M C S M C. mh 7--6t

div3.head: Sugar.
div3.p: --50 hhds prime New Orleans Sugar for sale by

div3.head:
By Thomas T Owens, Auctioneer,
[no. 202 Main st.]
div3.p: Furiture, Shoemakers' Tools, &c.--I will sell at the residence of Mrs. Marsch, corner of Broad and 8th sts, this morning, at 10 o'clock, all her Furniture, Bedding, &c, embracing--

list.item: A lot of Soap, Candles and Matcher,

div3.head: By Goddin & Apperson, Auctioneers.
div3.p:
Commissioner's Sale of 725 acres of land near Chesterfield Court-House.--At the request of Mr H Hancock, Commissioner of Chesterfield Circuit Court, in the case of Hancock against Hancock, &c. we shall sell at public auction, at Chesterfield Court-House, on Monday, March 9th, 1863, at 12 o'clock M, that portion of the land of the late Capt Benj Graves as was assigned to his widow as dower, containing 725 acres. It lies within one mile of Chesterfield Court-House, on Swift Creek, and on the Genito road.
The buildings are not good, yet with some repairs they could be made comfortable.
There is some good land on it, and old orchards of fine fruits.
About one-third of the tract is open land; about one-third in original growth, embracing some fine oak and pine timber, and one-third in secondary growth, suitable for cord wood.

Terms.--One-fourth cash; balance at 6, 12, and 18 months, for bonds, bearing interest, secured by the retention of the title.
The taxes for this year to be paid by the purchaser.
A plat of the land can be seen at our office.

Two Valuable Tenements on Broad street, near to Monroe street, for sale at Auction.--Will be sold at auction, on the premises, on Monday, 9th March, 1863, at 4 o'clock P M, the large Brick and Framed Tenement on the south side of Bread street, now occupied by Mr Joseph August, containing 8 rooms.

Also, the large Wood and Brick Tenement on the north side of Broad street, now occupied by Mr Joseph Hankey, containing 10 rooms.
Both of the foregoing houses are in improving parts of the city.

Terms--Cash.
The taxes and insurance for this year to be paid by the purchasers.

div3.head: By James M. Taylor & Son, Auctioneers.
div3.p: Most Valuable building Lot on the Dock at Auction.--We will sell on Monday, 9th March, 1863, commencing at 12 o'clock M, that very valuable Lot on the south side of Cary street, between 20th and 21st streets, adjoining the Towing Company's lot and the property of the late John Enders; extending from Cary to Water or Dock street, having a front of 44 feet on each of the above-named streets, and a depth of 120 feet.
The proximity of this property to water navigation and the York River Railroad fenders it the most desirable property now to be obtained in the entire city for mercantile purposes.

Terms.--One third cash; balance at 4 and 8 months, for negotiable notes, secured by trust deeds.
Taxes for 1863 to be paid by the purchaser.

Immediately after the above sale we will sell a Lot of 22 feet, situated at the corner of Cary and 23d streets, extending southwardly about 100 feet to Dock street. This is the first lot west of the depot of the York River Railroad, thereby rendering it exceedingly valuable for any kind of business.
div3.closer:
Jas M Taylor & Son,
Auctioneers. mh 5

By Wm H. Fowle & Sons, Aucts,

div3.head: By Richard Cauthern, Auct'r.
div3.p:
New Books at Auction — On Monday, 9th inst, at 10 o'clock A M, at my store.
I will sell at auction, about 200 volumes new Books, comprising Biography, Poetry, Tales, History, Travels, Voyages, Books for children, etc all new and handsomely bound in muslin and sheep.
Furniture.
Also, a lot of Furniture, consisting of Chairs, Bedsteads, Safe, Cooking Stoves, Feather Beds, Bedding, Tables, etc.

R Cauthorn,
Auctioneer mh 7

div3.head: By Hill, Dickinson & Co, Auct's
div3.p: Sheriff's Sale of Slaves.--On the 9th day of March, at 10 o'clock, at the auction house of Hill, Dickinson & Co, I, Sheriff of the county of New Kent, will sell the following Slaves, the property of T D Gilliam, to wit — Eliza and two children, Julia Ann and William — to the highest bidder, for cash.

New Richmond Theatre.
acting and Stage Manager, R D'orsey Ogden.
div3.p:
Notice.--In consequence of the death of Miss Jennie Partington, the Management beg leave to present the following on this
Monday evening, March 9th, 1863,
Tom Taylor's elegant Comely of
still Waters Run Deep.
In which Mr R D Ogden will make his first appearance, since his severe illness, as Capt Harry Hawksley.

to conclude with the Farce of
Sudden Thoughts.
For particulars see small bills.
Box Office now open, where seats and boxes may be secured.

Doors open at quarter to seven.
Performance will commence quarter to eight o'clock precisely.

div3.head: Ho for pleasure!
div3.p:
The lovers of dancing will attend a
Grand Ball,
to be given at the Drill Room, on 16th street, between Main and Cary, on Monday evening, March 9th, 1863.
A good Cotilion Band will be in attendance.

div3.head: Mules, Wagons, &c., for Sale.
div3.p: Two pairs of fine Mules, young, gentle, and well broke — really superior animals.
--Also,--
One four-horse Wagon, running Gear and Harness complete.
div3.closer:

Chas Armstrong,
Medical Parvevor's Office Pearist. mh 9--3t*

div3.head: Clover and Timothy seed.
div3.closer:
For sale by
Spotts & Harvey,
No. 29 14th st. mh 9--1t*

div3.p: The Attention of Sutlers is called to my large supply of Pocket-Books, which I offer for sale at wholesale on reasonable terms.--An early call is solicited at
div3.closer:
Henry Kayton's, 21 Main st.
Richmond Va. mh 9--1t*

div3.p:
I have for sale a small Farm of 200 acres which I will sell at a moderate price.
This place has a good dwelling and all other necessary out-houses and a plenty of original growth timber of all kind, in Caroline county, 40 miles from the place, on the Fredericksburg Railroad, 6 miles from Chesterfield Depot.

div3.head:
Adj't and Inps.
Gen Office,
div3.p: [Extract.]
Special Orders No. 53.--

VIII.
All Horses and Mules in this city in the service of the Government, or the officers thereof will be denied their rations of Forage is kind, after the expiration of eight days from this date, unless a certificate is exhibited with claim to such Forage from General Winter that such Horses and Mules are required for the service of the command within the limits of this Department.
div3.closer:
By command of the Secretary of West
[Signed] Jno Witnees, As. Adjt Gen. mh 5--1w
